intro: Omphalococca, commonly known as the "tulip tree" or "yellow tulip tree," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Nyssaceae. It comprises a few species, with Omphalococca chlorata being the most well-known. These plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The leaves are typically ovate and have a smooth texture, while the bark is smooth and reddish-brown. Omphalococca is native to eastern North America and is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland areas.
